author: Bonnie B

comment: Personally, now I feel REALLY offended at this response from filmmakers.  Wow.  Kind of a crappy brushing off of all of us,  like we don't matter.   Like mere flies buzzing around their heads.   Why make movies at all if that's actually how they feel about movie goers?  What a jaded way to think of the people who pay to see their films.  They still don't understand what really motivated our rejection of Heard in the first place because they didn't really listen, clearly.  I'm not going to the movie, simply because I don't want to look at her face, knowing exactly all she did!   She abused the ACLU and the courts for her own personal advantage out of a vindictive, selfish, rather greedy purpose.  Most women I know that have actually been abused wouldn't even think of going public after a trauma like that, let alone invite a gaggle of reporters to photograph her, while she turned her face just so they could all take a good pic of her "bruise" that was mysteriously gone the very next day. Then she scratched herself for other pics, all while lying.  UGH!  This whole thing is just so wrong, on many levels.  Many women have suffered awful abuse and others ended up dead, so her malignant antics hurt them all. THAT's why it's so reprehensible to see someone like her, with so much going for her, abuse the legal system to destroy another person's entire life.  Taking his his jobs, his money, his property and his dignity. So, that's my itty bitty little stance!

comment:
I decided to boycott Aquaman 2 a long time ago.  And since that is not enough, well I have a solution.

Every time a Superhero film is made Frito Lay, Pepsi Cola, General Mills, or some other food product advertise the film on their product.  Refuse to buy these items.  Refuse to buy the toy line that comes out.  Refuse to buy anything related to Aquaman 2 or Amber Heard.

Boycotting a film only helps some.  Boycotting their advertisers, and stopping the flow of their sponsorship money, that is a whole different ball game.

If their funds are cut off, and advertisers refuse to sponsor their product, it is game over.  So do not just boycott the films.  Boycott their sponsors as well.
